text:
If you 
have had GBS in a previous 
pregnancy	you	will	be	offered	
either testing for GBS at 35-37 
weeks or antibiotics in labour.
Your obstetrician or midwife
will assess whether you need
to be given antibiotics during
labour. If you need antibiotics,
they will be given through a 
vein (intravenously).
Treatment for GBS
In some circumstances 
antibiotics can reduce the risk 
of a baby developing GBS. You 
should	be	offered	antibiotics	
during labour if:
